Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Epidural Tramadol and Morphine for Analgesia in Cats

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved six healthy cats

Intervention.evidence: each receiving an epidural injection of saline 0.22 ml/kg (control treatment, CT), tramadol 1 mg/kg (tramadol treatment, TT), or morphine 0.1 mg/kg (morphine treatment, MT)

Objective.evidence: The objective of this study was to compare the analgesic effects of epidural tramadol versus morphine in cats.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was analgesia level, assessed using a simple descriptive scale (SDS), visual analog scale (VAS), and physiological parameters at 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 hours post-epidural.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to treatment groups.

Number_Analysed.evidence: All six cats were randomised and analysed.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Group TT had higher SDS and VAS scores compared to MT at 8, 10, and 12 hours post-epidural.
